column3: All right. I presume you've brought the necessary documentation, then?
We'll see to the rest, don't you worry. Be sure you don't misplace your proof of covering─you'll need it when you return to collect the fledgling.
To confirm the date after which you may collect your fledgling, refer to the proof of covering's help text.
Hold on─didn't we just arrange a covering for you? I'm afraid there are certain restrictions...
You cannot arrange another covering until you have collected your newborn fledgling.
Hm? You haven't <Emphasis>any</Emphasis> retired chocobo registration forms? You do realize they're essential, don't you?
You cannot arrange a covering without a retired chocobo registration form in your possession.
Maybe it's just me, but you seem to be carrying an awful lot at the moment...
You cannot arrange a covering without space in your inventory to store the proof of covering.
I see you've brought a retired chocobo registration form. That's good. Unfortunately, you don't seem to have any forms for a compatible chocobo. That's bad.
You cannot arrange a covering without forms for two compatible chocobos.
All coverings require a sire and a dam. However, please note that both chocobos cannot be breeding stock.
